com.randallscharpf.java.jmorsecoding.base.timings

Class FarnsworthTiming

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.randallscharpf.java.jmorsecoding.base.timings.FarnsworthTiming
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MorseTiming

    public final class FarnsworthTiming
extends java.lang.Object
implements MorseTiming
    A two-parameter timing used for beginners learning Morse Code. Based on the recommendations in https://www.arrl.org/files/file/Technology/x9004008.pdf. This timing uses a certain WPM for the rate at which symbols are sent, giving them the characteristic rhythm they have under similarly-rated professional timings, while adding in extra spacing between symbols to slow the overall rate down to a different WPM. It sets the gap between two dots, two dashes, or a dot and a dash to be the same length as a dot. It sets a dash to be three times this length. It also independently sets the ratio between the gap between two characters within a word and the gap between two words to be 3:7.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Detail

      • settings

        public final FarnsworthTiming.Settings settings
        The settings for this instance. To modify the settings of this timing, users must call methods on this member.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • FarnsworthTiming

        public FarnsworthTiming()
        Creates a FarnsworthTiming an overall rate of 8 WPM with characters sent at an 18 WPM rhythm. These values are calculated using the standard word PARIS. They can be changed by interacting with the settings object of this timing, as in this.settings.setWpm(10, 20);. The ratios between symbol elements (element gap : dot : dash) is fixed at 1:1:3 and the ratio between non-symbol elements (letter gap : word gap) is fixed at 3:7.
        Since:
        1.0

      • FarnsworthTiming

        public FarnsworthTiming(double wpm)
        Creates a FarnsworthTiming with the specified overall rate. The character rhythm is 18 WPM if the overall WPM is slower than this, otherwise the character rhythm and overall rate are defined by the same WPM values.
        Parameters:
        wpm - the overall WPM rate with which to setup the timing specification
        Since:
        1.0

      • FarnsworthTiming

        public FarnsworthTiming(double overallWpm,
                        double charWpm)
        Creates a FarnsworthTiming with the specified overall rate and character rhythm. The character rhythm must be specified by a WPM value no slower than the overall rate.
        Parameters:
        overallWpm - the overall WPM rate with which to setup the timing specification
        charWpm - the WPM rate to use to determine the rhythm of characters
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • timeForElementType

        public java.time.Duration timeForElementType(ElementType type)
        Gives the duration for which the unit should be played. For a dot or dash, this time is the amount of time for which the output signal is "on". For a gap, this is the amount of time for which the output signal is "off".
        Specified by:
        timeForElementType in interface MorseTiming
        Parameters:
        type - the type of Morse Code unit for which to get the duration
        Returns:
        the time that should be spent transmitting a unit of the type, as a Duration
        Since:
        1.0
